instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.I2C_PWR_SCL: What is I2C_PWR_SCL? I2C_PWR_SCL is the clock line of the SMBUS data line between the system management controller(SMC), battery, ISL9240 battery charging chip, and power management unit(PMU). This line is necessary for the machine to communicate with the battery, see the battery, and use the battery. When this line is malfunctioning or shorted to ground, the machine will have an X icon over the battery and not run off the battery. .
definitions.I2C_PWR_SDA: What is I2C_PWR_SDA? I2C_PWR_SDA is the SMBUS data line between the system management controller(SMC), battery, ISL9240 battery charging chip, and power management unit(PMU). This line is necessary for the machine to communicate with the battery, see the battery, and use the battery. When this line is malfunctioning or shorted to ground, the machine will have an X icon over the battery and not run off the battery. .
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
The board only on desk draws (charger only)5v 0.27A
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.32v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>=3.3v
System boots with batteryand charger and stay on with battery :<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=12.32v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>=3.3v..
But not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Did you test the board alone on the desk with original 96/140W charger?

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
I used original 96W charger 

<SIGNAL>I2C_PWR_SDA</SIGNAL>=0.466 and 1.799v
<SIGNAL>I2C_PWR_SCL</SIGNAL>=0.465 and 1.799v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
When booted with battery, macOS shows battery percentage?

Check <SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL>.
You still have problems on USB-C areas.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
It shows battery percentage....
The board first came in dead i found short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_UBC</SIGNAL> then passed current through it found <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> get in hot and i replaced it..
Short gone

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>UPC_I2C_INT_L</SIGNAL> diode mode to ground is 0.510
With 0volt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: Some peoples on Internet claim that this board only accepts <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips from same model scrap board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: I should find exact board and replace the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: The system is not entering DFU
